COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. 

 A negative COVID-19 test issued no more than 72 hours prior to departure is required for entry. Test results must be a complete report and presented on the official letterhead of the laboratory where the test was conducted.
column3:
Quarantine requirement at government designated site.


All incoming international travelers are required to quarantine at a government-supervised facility for 21 days.

Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to Tonga: A State of Emergency was declared on 20 March 2020 by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga, this has been renewed until 8pm on 9 May 2022. Tongan borders are closed to entry to all foreign nationals, except if authorisation is granted by the relevant Tongan government authorities.
No international cruise ships and yachts will be granted entry into Tonga until further notice.
Some countries in the region have also introduced travel restrictions to and from the Pacific islands. You should check specifics for any countries that might be involved in your travel when planning a trip to Tonga.
Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: Tonga will only accept the printed version of proof of COVID-19 recovery and vaccination record and proof of COVID-19 vaccination issued in the Crown Dependencies. They will not accept digital proof. They will not accept digital proof. Tonga will only accept fully vaccinated (two doses) passengers on repatriation flights, with booster vaccines preferred. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
Visas: If you hold a short-term visa for Tonga which is close to expiry, you should report to the Immigration Office to have your visa extended. Further information can be found at the Ministry of Revenue & Customs website.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Tonga: Tonga is currently subject to two States of Emergency and National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions. A State of Emergency for Public Health was renewed by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga until 8pm on 6 June. A second State of Emergency, following the Hunga-Tonga Hunga-Ha’apai volcanic eruption, has also been renewed until 8am on 5 June2022. The latter lists several Tongan islands, plus locations on Tongatapu and Ha’apai, that members of the public are prohibited from entering during this period.
Under the National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions, Tonga operates a Traffic Light Framework which sets the baseline restrictions and any differing timings of the overnight curfew on each island.
For more information on the States of Emergency and the National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions, including each island’s current Traffic Light status, you should check the latest declarations on the Government of the Kingdom of Tonga’s website.
*Public places and services: The National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions limit access to public places including places of worship, restaurants, bars and nightclubs. For the latest information on each Tongan island please check the latest declarations on the Government of the Kingdom of Tonga’s website.
